Polish Survivors of the Holocaust: an oral history project
1980-1982
CPAA 96-01

did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Polish Survivors of the Holocaust: an oral history project

repository.label: Location:
repository.corpname: Connecticut Polish American Archives, Elihu Burritt Library, Central Connecticut State University

did.abstract: Polish Survivors of the Holocaust, an oral history project was initiated by Prof. Stanislaus A. Blejwas from Central Connecticut State College and co-sponsored by the Association of Polish Priests in Connecticut. The project was funded by the Connecticut Humanities Council. Parts of the interviews were broadcasted in a miniseries at the Connecticut Public Radio. All interviews were transcribed. Collection contains documentation of the project, related correspondence and various publications on Polish Jewish relations and teaching the Holocaust. Collection illustrates experience of non-Jewish survivors of the Nazi concentration camps in World War II, who immigrated to the US and lived in Connecticut.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Polish Survivors of the Holocaust: an oral history project was sponsored by the grant from the Connecticut Humanities Council and several Polish American organizations. The project was proposed by Prof. Stanislaus Blejwas, from the department of History at Central Connecticut State College and Msgr. John Wodarski, pastor of the Holy Cross church representing the Association of Polish Priests in Connecticut. The project followed a public protest after the broadcasting of a popular TV mini-series "Holocaust" that, in Polish American opinion, portrayed Poles unfairly. The project was inaugurated by a technical workshop for interviewers and a public forum. The purpose of both was to emphasize the issue of complexity of the Holocaust, publicize the project, and locate additional survivors.

Between 1980 and 1981 four interviewers - Prof. Stanislaus Blejwas, Dr. M.B. Biskupski, Mrs. Aleksandra Nowakowska, and Mr. Joseph Jedynak - conducted and recorded interviews with 32 Polish gentiles, survivors of Nazi concentration camps. The interviews were broadcasted by the Connecticut Public Radio in 5-part series in April 1982. The tapes were later transcribed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Collection includes documentation of the project, original tapes, transcription of tapes and English translation if necessary. Also included in the collection are materials describing various Polish American initiatives that aimed at educating American public opinion about Polish losses during WWII and Polish-Jewish relations during the war.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Cite as:Polish Survivors of the Holocaust: an oral history project (CPAA 96-01). Connecticut Polish American Archives, Central Connecticut State University, New Britain.

acqinfo.p: Material in the collection was donated by Prof. Stanislaus A. Blejwas.

processinfo.p: Material was processed by Ewa Wolynska and Renata Vickrey.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Collection is kept in the original arrangement it was received.

dsc.p: [The following section contains a detailed listing of the materials in the collection.]
